docs.snippet: New York racing investigators have established to their satisfaction that the horse that ran and won at Belmont Park last September as the long-shot "Lebon" was actually the Uruguayan champion Cinzano, and that Dr. Mark J. Gerard was the hidden owner...
docs.lead_paragraph: New York racing investigators have established to their satisfaction that the horse that ran and won at Belmont Park last September as the long-shot "Lebon" was actually the Uruguayan champion Cinzano, and that Dr. Mark J. Gerard was the hidden owner of the horse.

headline.main: Inquiry Finds Fraud in Race-Horse Switch; Inquiry Finds Fraud in Race-Horse Switch

docs.snippet: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 3 The first proposals to protect horseplayers from a repeat of the intriguing "ringer" case in New York was made today by the registrar of The Jockey Club.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R., Dec. 3 The first proposals to protect horseplayers from a repeat of the intriguing "ringer" case in New York was made today by the registrar of The Jockey Club.
docs.abstract: Jockey Club official Alfredo Garcia tells conv of Caribbean horsemen, San Juan, PR, that system of selling horses in Latin Amer should be changed and that govts should become directly involved in providing proof of horses identification (M)

docs.snippet: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 5--Dr. Mark J. Gerard, the veterinarian accused of switching the race horses Cinzano and Lebon in a betting coup, surrendered to Nassau County authorities this afternoon and pleaded not guilty to a nine-count indictment detailing...
docs.lead_paragraph: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 5--Dr. Mark J. Gerard, the veterinarian accused of switching the race horses Cinzano and Lebon in a betting coup, surrendered to Nassau County authorities this afternoon and pleaded not guilty to a nine-count indictment detailing charges in the case.
docs.abstract: Gerard pleads not quilty; released on $100,000 bail (M)

headline.main: Gerard Out On Bail After Indictment; Gerard, Indicted on Nine Counts, Pleads Not Guilty, is out on Bail

docs.snippet: LONDON There are major differences between so-called political terrorism (as distinct from purely commercial crime) and the nihilist and anarchist movements that promoted violence in the 19th and early 20th centuries.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 21 The General Assembly ended its 32d session today after having adopted a $986 million budget for the coming two years and a record number of 256 resolutions.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 21 The General Assembly ended its 32d session today after having adopted a $986 million budget for the coming two years and a record number of 256 resolutions.
docs.abstract: US Amb Andrew Young tells closing session of UN Gen Assembly that members did not seem ready to appreciate opportunities for Middle East peace, opened by initiative by Sadat; says there seems real possibility that world is passing UN by; Chaim Herzog of Israel scores anti-Israeli decisions adopted by session; closing hrs of session are marked by clash between Israel and Syria, touched off by Herzog's criticism of budgetary items that he says are intended to vilify Israel; Mouaffak Allaf of Syria scores Israel as 'racist' (S)

headline.main: U.N. Assembly Adopts Budget, Ending 32d Session

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 22 (AP) Argentina's navy chief said in a statement published yesterday that it was time for the military junta to carry out its original agreement, which would mean reducing the authority of President Jorge Videla, the army...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 22 (AP) Argentina's navy chief said in a statement published yesterday that it was time for the military junta to carry out its original agreement, which would mean reducing the authority of President Jorge Videla, the army commander and a junta member.
docs.abstract: Council on Hemispheric Affairs says human rights situation in Brazil is gradually improving (S)

headline.main: ARGENTINE PRESIDENT FACING A CHALLENGE; Navy Chief Indicates the Powers of Videla Should Be Reduced
